snippet: An appeals court ruled that the police had no reasonable cause to search a 14-year-old boy in the Bronx, even though an illegal gun was found on him.
abstract: New York State Appeals court, for the second time in a week, overturns conviction of a teenager who was arrested after the police found a concealed handgun during a stop-and-frisk encounter; in each case, the panel ruled that the arresting officer did not have reasonable suspicion to stop and search the boy involved even though an illegal weapon was subsequently found.
lead_paragraph: An appeals court ruled that the police had no reasonable cause to search a 14-year-old boy in the Bronx, even though an illegal gun was found on him.

headline.seo: Appeals Court Throws Out 2nd Gun Conviction in Stop-and-Frisk Case
headline.main: Second Weapon Conviction Is Overturned on Frisk Issue
headline.print_headline: Second Weapon Conviction Is Overturned on Frisk Issue
